items.sentence: Did you know that both Tom and Mary are blind in one eye?
Tom and his two bodyguards came in through the back door.
Tom asked Mary if she wanted a sandwich and she said yes.
Tom blew on the embers, hoping to get the fire restarted.
Tom says he plans on staying in Boston as long as he can.
Tom said something in French that I couldn\'t understand.
Tom reached for the bottle and poured Mary another drink.
Tom seemed to be trying to convince Mary to do something.
Tom swept the kitchen floor while Mary washed the dishes.
Tom told Mary not to blame herself for what had happened.
I don\'t know anyone I can practice speaking French with.
I don\'t think that Tom will be using his umbrella today.
I have a feeling Tom won\'t do what he\'s promised to do.
Tom tiptoed into the bedroom to avoid waking up his wife.
Tom took off his wedding ring and threw it into the pond.
Tom was determined to finish the job before he went home.
Tom is the only one in our family who has been to Boston.
Tom is the only one likely to be in the office on Monday.
Tom is the only one on this island that can speak French.
Tom is trying hard to get the report written before 2:30.
Tom is under pressure to find a solution to this problem.
At first, I didn\'t like it, but it gradually became fun.
Mary pulled out her knitting needles and started to knit.
No matter what you say, I don\'t think Tom is a nice guy.
Please don\'t bring alcoholic beverages into the stadium.
Tom doesn\'t seem to appreciate what we\'ve done for him.
Tom took a folded piece of paper out of his shirt pocket.
Tom was surprised that Mary caught more fish than he did.
Tom often comes over and swims laps in our swimming pool.
Tom often eats things that other people consider strange.
Tom often goes fishing on Sundays if the weather is good.
Tom only had a dim recollection of what Mary looked like.
Tom paused for a moment before continuing with the story.
If you ever do come to Boston, definitely give me a call.
I wish I hadn\'t promised Tom I\'d go to Boston with him.
I wish that I hadn\'t given Tom my grandfather\'s violin.
Tom was angry because I didn\'t help him paint the fence.
Tom was caught stealing apples from his neighbor\'s tree.
It\'s difficult to help people who don\'t want your help.
You never get a second chance to make a first impression.
Why did you decide to learn how to play the English horn?
Are you telling me that Tom doesn\'t know how to do that?
You\'re the only Canadian I know who doesn\'t like bacon.
Did Tom really drink the whole bottle of wine by himself?
Tom and Mary have lived in Boston since they got married.
Tom and Mary were married in October on a tropical beach.
Tom\'s parents told me that he would be going to Harvard.
Tom came to France with the intention of studying French.
Tom clicked a button on his remote, but nothing happened.
Tom complained that his wife was spending too much money.
